description.text: God's Word is clear about the importance of godly friendships - and how God designs them to complete us spiritually. If you ever hope to win the battles you face in your spiritual journey, you must be connected to godly men. Join us every week for bible study and small group discussion time!

name.text: [精华]长周末首都华盛顿DC节日活动攻略
name.html: [精华]长周末首都华盛顿DC节日活动攻略

description.text:
How to JOIN our thousands-of-members community? 扫华聚公号! 
  


在Facebook上LIKE我们的华聚精英主页并且LIKE & SHARE华聚活动www.facebook.com/chinausfusion 


注册华聚论坛的小伙伴 www.chinausfusion.com 


扫一扫华聚微信 "chinausfusionelite" 


Facebook add as friend: www.facebook.com/chinausfusionelite 


  
 
  
  
Friday 
Jazz in the Garden 
Friday nights in the NGA’s Sculpture Garden are back in full “swing” this summer, featuring the likes of artists such as Louisiana Funk, Afropop and Blusion. Starting this weekend, bring your picnic snacks and lay your tarps down early to listen to the cool sounds of Elikeh. 
When: 6:30 p.m. Free and open to the public. 
Where: National Gallery of Art Sculpture Garden, 700 Constitution Avenue NW 
 
 
Grand Opening of the Capital Wheel 
The National Harbor is taking revelers to new heights and new city views on the Capital Wheel. Soaring 180 feet above the Potomac River, get a panoramic view of the District and surrounding neighborhoods, including views of the White House, U.S. Capitol, National Mall and Arlington Cemetery. 
When: 11 a.m. - 10 p.m. Tickets are $15 for adults, $11.25 for children age 3-11 and free for children age 2 and under. 
Where: National Harbor, National Harbor Boulevard, Fort Washington, MD 
 
 
Saturday 
Summerfest DC 
While the official start of summer isn't technically until next month, we're all for an early celebration. Complete with live music, great peeps, local bites and unlimited tasting of more than 100 craft beers all day, Summerfest is sure to set the season off on the right (dancing) foot. 
When: 12 - 7 p.m. Purchase tickets here. 
Where: Half Street Fairgrounds, 25 M Street SE 
 
 
Run or Dye 5K 
Add some crazy color to your life this weekend by running, walking, skipping or dancing at the Run or Dye 5K. We can't think of anything more fun than getting covered (seriously, wear clothes you don't mind dying a rainbow of neon colors) in paint while running around town with your friends. 
When: 9 a.m. Register here. 
Where: RFK Stadium, 2400 East Capital Street NE 
 
Sunday 
4th Annual Crab Festival 
Everything at Policy is guided by its slogan of "Truth, Love, and Liberty." Truth: Nothing says a DC summer like crabs and beer. Love: it’s Sunday Funday. Liberty: Enjoy your day off with all-you-can-eat crabs and cold brews fresh from Atlas Brew Works’ taps. 
When: 12 p.m. - 5 p.m. Tickets are $45. 
Where: Policy, 1904 14th Street NW 
 
 
PBS National Memorial Day Concert 
A beloved Memorial Day tradition, this annual concert held on the West Lawn of the U.S. Capitol honors all those who have made the ultimate sacrifice for our country. Hosted by Joe Mantegna and Gary Sinise, the star-studded lineup includes Sugarland’s Jennifer Nettles, The Voice’s Danielle Bradbery, theater and television star Megan Hilty as well as the National Symphony Orchestra, U.S. Army Herald Trumpets, U.S. Singing Sergeants and more. See the full lineup here. 
When: 8 p.m. Free and open to the public. 
Where: West Lawn of US Capitol

description.text:
Maria Matarelli is a Certified Professional Coach, business consultant, and a contributing author in the Business Leaders Book Series: Lessons Learned from the Recession.
A workflow management expert, Maria consults organizations from start up companies to Fortune 100 companies on business efficiencies, process improvements, and organizational change. Maria travels to speak at national and international conferences with recent locations including Chicago, New York, Hawaii, Vancouver, Sweden, and Morocco.
Consultant turned entrepreneur, Maria has achieved 10 industry certifications and has held leadership positions to include VP of Operations and President of several not for profit professional development organizations.

description.text:
Wine by the glass is available for purchase.  View our Sip List 
  
  
  
A local artist will teach you how to recreate a work of art, through step by step instruction.  At the end of the session, you can take home your masterpiece. 
  
  
  
No experience is required! Painting session includes 16x20 canvas and art supplies. Registering for this event indicates that you agree to the terms below:  Participants must be 21 and over; Please drink responsibly.  No late arrivals; voucher subject to forfeiture (if applicable). Reservations and seating are first-come, first-served. If you bring your own bottle, open or empty wine bottles may not be removed from the studio. No refunds; A credit can be issued for another event. 48 hour cancellation or reschedule notice required. Classes are subject to cancellation if less than 10 painters are registered. 
  
  
  
About: Merlot's Masterpiece is a place where you can drink wine and paint in DC.  Also known as sip n paint, wine paint and canvas, wine and painting classes, painting and wine, sipping n painting.

name.text: Paint Night! Paint a Stone Harbor or Avalon Scene on Artist Canvas
name.html: Paint Night! Paint a Stone Harbor or Avalon Scene on Artist Canvas

description.text:
Located in the center of Stone Harbor, Island Studio is a fun, fresh twist on your average night out!!

For $45, come on in, grab a canvas, grab a seat, chose a drink, get comfortable and we will take it from there!! 

Sit back, relax as local artist, Brenda Dolhanczyk guides you through recreating our featured painting of the night!

Not artsy? Not even a little bit? NO PROBLEM!! 
NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY!! We promise!

Everyone leaves with a masterpiece!! There are no mistakes, only happy accidents!! You will be surprised at how nice your painting turns out!! 
NO STRESSING OUT ALLOWED!! That's why we want you to enjoy a beverage of choice, wine, or beer...if you start to feel stressed out or nervous about your painting, please, DRINK UP!! 

Once the fun is over, leave all the mess!! We will take care of that too!!
Want to come and check it out? Here is what you do:
1. Go to the CALENDAR tab and click!
2. Select the date/painting that you would like to attend.
3. Reserve your tickets - you can pay online or at the door.
4. Print out your tickets
5. On the night of your HAPPY HOUR...grab your tickets, beverages, and snacks and COME ON OVER!!
THE TIME LISTED ON YOUR TICKET IS WHEN WE START PAINTING!! YOU CAN ARRIVE  UP TO A HALF HOUR BEFORE, TO POUR YOURSELF A DRINK, GRAB A SNACK AND GET COMFY.

name.text: Johnny Wimbrey - Best Selling Author
name.html: Johnny Wimbrey - Best Selling Author

description.text:
Sought after by companies all over the world, Johnny Wimbrey's message has encouraged thousands to find their own inner greatness. His story of growing up in the ‘hood is not an easy one to hear, but his journey to wealth and happiness is a testament to the power of the human spirit. From adversity to prosperity, Johnny Wimbrey empowers others with his story. 

Johnny Wimbrey has transformed his life from a mess into a message and now encourages others around the world to NEVER let your past determine your future. As an inspirational speaker, motivator, and sales training professional, Wimbrey has shared the stage with personal development gurus such as Les Brown, Jim Rohn, Zig Ziglar, and many others. 
If you love the concept of Travel, Fun, Freedom and Fulfilment.  
  
We strongly invite you to come to this event. 
P.S. Please call 0402232004 (Dimitrios Vrousgos) to also confirm that you are coming so we can have someone waiting for you.

name.text: ​Monday Men's Connect - God’s Design for Your Life Study
name.html: ​Monday Men's Connect - God’s Design for Your Life Study

description.text: This study will help you and your small group overcome the challenges that you are facing as you seek to discover and live out God’s design for your life. It is an experiential series focused on practicing the lessons that we can learn from King David’s life. Prepare to build deeper relationships, jump-start your spiritual growth, discover how God has designed you to serve others, connect with God in fresh ways and share the stories of how God has transformed your life.  God’s Design for Your Life will transform your group whether it’s been meeting for years or is just getting started. Monday evenings 7 - 9 pm (Saddleback Irvine Offices). Questions: Contact Eric Chyo (ericchyo@gmail.com) or Chris Norwood (ChrisN@aditi.com)

description.text:
Taller de fotografía nocturna en Puerto Rico:

Reserva tu espacio por solo
$20

Sábado 14 de junio de 2014.
Horario: 6pm a 9pm.
Lugar: Plaza Quinto Centenario (Totem) en Viejo San Juan, Puerto Rico.
Separa tu espacio por solo $20. Pagas restante $20 día del taller.
Completamente practico para que obtengas mayor beneficio.
Curso para cámaras de lentes intercambiables sin importar marca.




 


Profesor 
 Abnel Gonzalez 

  

DETALLES 

El talleresta diseñado para personas que tienen poco o ningún conocimiento en fotografía. Aprenderás las bases de la fotografia nocturna la cual es una de las mas complicadas. Tendras la oportunidad de crear efectos, dibujos con luz y muchas otras cosas.

Balance de blancos. Como corregir color de las luces nocturnas

Crear dibujos con luz (light graffity)

ISO y sensibilidad a la luz: Ideal para aprender a tomar fotos en condiciones de poca luz.

Requisitos: 

Cámara que pueda ser utilizada en modo manual, no importa marca.
Trípode.




  
  
Si tienes dudas o preguntas puedes comunicarte L-S al 787-421-4908 de 11am a 6pm o escribirnos a info@fotografospuertorico.com

name.text: Route of the Hiawatha Bike Ride 6/19/14 at 10:30 am
name.html: Route of the Hiawatha Bike Ride 6/19/14 at 10:30 am

description.text:
This activity is organized by Exploring Families for its members. Non-members (guests) can also attend one Exploring Families sponsored activity, such as this one. Pre-registration and pre-payment (if applicable) for each activity for guests and members is required here: www.ExploringFamilies.com.  Full Summer and School Year Members can attend as many activities as they want.  For guests, your first activity with Exploring Families is complimentary. Try an Exploring Families tour or trip before you become a Member. (If there is an activity fee (ex: museum entrance fee), the attendees must pay the fee, whether they are an Exploring Families member or one time guest.) 
Where We will bike from the East Portal trail head to the West Portal trail head. We will meet at the Lookout Pass Ski Area at 10:30 am. The Ski Area is located adjacent to I-90 at the Idaho-Montana state line at Exit 0, in Mullan, ID, 12 miles east of historic Wallace, ID. The East Portal is 7 miles from Lookout Pass.  The ride from East Portal (top) to Pearson (bottom) is 15 miles and is a very gentle downhill ride all the way. For most riders, this represents a leisurely 2.5 hour ride.  You can ride the trail at any speed you like.  We do not have to stay together as a group.  It was called one of the most scenic stretches of railroad in the country. When the Milwaukee Railroad was operating, the trains traversed through 11 tunnels and over 9 high trestles, covering a 46 mile route that crossed the rugged Bitterroot Mountains between Idaho and Montana. The "Route of the Hiawatha" is most famous for the long St. Paul Pass, or Taft Tunnel which burrows for 8771 ft. (1.66 miles) under the Bitterroot Mountains at the state line. 
Costs: Your reservation options with Exploring Families are Trail Passes and Shuttle Tickets only.  If you want to rent a bike or any accessories, you'll need to make your own arrangements. Trail Pass Adult 14+: $10  Trail Pass Child 6-13 years: $6 Shuttle Ticket Adult 14+: $9 Shuttle Ticket Child 6-13 years: $6 No cost for children 5 and younger.

description.text:
Exploring Families offers its member families terrific tours, fantastic field trips and spectacular special events helping students and their parents explore, discover, and learn outside of school time and beyond the books.  We specialize in a great variety of educational activities with a S.T.E.M. focus (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math).  Our trips, tours, and events take place all year long and many of our activities are free.     Member families can attend as many activities as they want.  Family memberships start at just $10 per month for unlimited activities for the whole family!  For guests, your first activity with Exploring Families is complimentary.  Try an Exploring Families activity before you become a Member!  There is never a charge to receive the Event Invitation emails that list all of the trips, tours, activities, and events we offer.     Exploring Families welcomes all families!       Our tours, trips, and events are in the Inland Northwest: the greater Spokane area, Eastern Washington, and North Idaho.  
Schools, school districts, groups, clubs, and programs can also purchase Exploring Families memberships for their students, or certain classes, grades, clubs, programs, or schools.  We can easily create a customized membership program just to meet the needs (and budget!) of your students and educators. 
Additionally, outside of our membership program, we design customized field trips and educational activities just for the needs of your group, club, class, or program.

description.text:
The Business Planning Workshop™ was designed by Miss Phyllis D. Wallace, Business Development Director for Miss PDW Enterprises, LLC to meet the challenges of current and aspiring entrepreneurs. Participants receive a Business Overview, Training and Expert Coaching for their business by Phyllis Wallace and in-house experts, such as Life Coach/Change Expert Susan Brown of Impact Coaching.  
 
Agenda 
 Welcome * Business Overview * Training * Presentations * Wrap-Up 
Complimentary drinks and light refreshments will be provided. 
No refunds after tickets have been purchased. The fees will be credited toward a future event. 
 Testimonials 

Mr. Sandy English, Independent Associate Legal Shield - "Great Workshop!"
Belinda M. Lane, Writer & Speaker - "I attended this workshop with high expectations from the information and reviews I read in reference to past workshops given by Miss Phyllis.  I can say I was not disappointed in any area.  The session was well planned. Attendees were given the opportunity to present their business and excellent feedback was given to each one.  This was a workshop where we didn't want to take a break because the momentum of the session was so charged.  I highly recommend this workshop as an avenue to move your business forward.  If you are just starting or even thinking about starting a business this is the workshop for you.  If you are already in business and appear to be at a standstill this is the workshop that will resuscitate your business with a breath of fresh air. If you are doing well in your business this workshop will help you see that there are no limits to where you can take your business.  Trust me this is no hype." 
Galyn Fergerson, CEO, G.R.I.T.S. Productions, LLC & Executive Producer, Curves Fashion Week - "Similar workshops I have attended are full of cliche one-liners, quotes from philanthropists, and non-niche specific motivational speakers. I got all of my questions answered at PDW Enterprises' Business Planning Workshop and left knowing what my next step would be."   
Judy Hollis, Faith Management Services  - "I was amazed that the class forced me to assess my value."

Business Champions™
description.html:
The Business Planning Workshop™ was designed by Miss Phyllis D. Wallace, Business Development Director for Miss PDW Enterprises, LLC to meet the challenges of current and aspiring entrepreneurs. Participants receive a Business Overview, Training and Expert Coaching for their business by Phyllis Wallace and in-house experts, such as Life Coach/Change Expert Susan Brown of Impact Coaching. 

Agenda

 Welcome * Business Overview * Training * Presentations * Wrap-Up

Complimentary drinks and light refreshments will be provided.

No refunds after tickets have been purchased. The fees will be credited toward a future event.

 Testimonials

  • Mr. Sandy English, Independent Associate Legal Shield - "Great Workshop!"
  • Belinda M. Lane, Writer & Speaker - "I attended this workshop with high expectations from the information and reviews I read in reference to past workshops given by Miss Phyllis.  I can say I was not disappointed in any area.  The session was well planned. Attendees were given the opportunity to present their business and excellent feedback was given to each one.  This was a workshop where we didn't want to take a break because the momentum of the session was so charged.  I highly recommend this workshop as an avenue to move your business forward.  If you are just starting or even thinking about starting a business this is the workshop for you.  If you are already in business and appear to be at a standstill this is the workshop that will resuscitate your business with a breath of fresh air. If you are doing well in your business this workshop will help you see that there are no limits to where you can take your business.  Trust me this is no hype." 
  • Galyn Fergerson, CEO, G.R.I.T.S. Productions, LLC & Executive Producer, Curves Fashion Week - "Similar workshops I have attended are full of cliche one-liners, quotes from philanthropists, and non-niche specific motivational speakers. I got all of my questions answered at PDW Enterprises' Business Planning Workshop and left knowing what my next step would be."   
  • Judy Hollis, Faith Management Services  - "I was amazed that the class forced me to assess my value."
Business Champions™
